node.title: Canberra man accused of trying to import child sex doll faces court
node.alt: The sign out of the front of the building and the crest, with an autumnal tree nearby and a blue sky beyond.
node.description: Jeffrey Scott Deacon appears inÂ the ACT Supreme Court, facing a charge of trying to import a prohibited item.
node.content: ["A Canberra man\u00a0is on trial in the ACT Supreme Court, accused of trying to import a child sex doll.", "Jeffrey Scott Deacon, 28, is facing a single charge of trying to import the prohibited item.", "He was arrested last year after Border Force officers intercepted the doll.", "The court heard Mr Deacon had told authorities he had ordered an adult doll.", "Prosecutor Ken Archer opened his case today, telling the jury their main task would be to decide if the doll depicted someone under the age of 18.", "The court has already viewed images of the doll, which Mr Deacon bought in September last year, from a website in China.", "A police search found he had been to a site dubbed 'little sex dolls', and had paid $428.", "In his initial interview with police, played to the jury, the officer told him how the doll was intercepted and had been addressed to him.", "When asked if they would find anything linked to the order on his phone Mr Deacon agreed there was.", "\"Probably an email,\" he told the officer.", "He also agreed he had used the phone to place the order and pay for it.", "Mr Archer said the company had written back to Mr Deacon to confirm the order, and he had discussed with them he wanted a \"standing doll\" with blue eyes.", "The images of the doll shown to the jury show a dark wig, but the item arrived with two blonde wigs as well.", "Mr Archer said when interviewed by police, Mr Deacon denied ordering a child doll, saying he had ordered an adult one.", "The trial will continue tomorrow when the jury is expected to be shown the doll in the court."]
